flawed_nl_solution:
20% of $45 is (20/100)*$45 = $<<(20/100)*45=225/1>>225/1
The price of the textbook in other bookshops cost $225/1 less than $45 which is $45-$225/1 = $<<45-225/1=-180>>-180
Three textbooks from the school bookshop would cost $45*3 = $<<45*3=135>>135
Three textbooks from another bookshop would cost $-180*3 = $<<-180*3=-540>>-540
Peter can save $135-$-540 = $<<135--540=675>>675 by buying from another bookshop
#### 675

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 9, not 225/1. It appears the value was multiplied by the reciprocal of the intended fraction.
